Schumacher is often credited with defining what a modern F1 driver is. Before him, drivers were talented but often lacked physical fitness. Schumacher trained like an Olympian.

Did You Know? In 2002, he was so dominant that he finished on the podium (Top 3) in every single race of the season. A record that still stands.

Senna drove with a spiritual intensity that terrified and amazed his rivals. He was a master of the rain. His rivalry with teammate Alain Prost was fierce.

Lauda was known for his cold, calculating logic. In 1976, he suffered a horrific fiery crash. Incredibly, he returned to the cockpit just 6 weeks later.

Did You Know? He holds the record for the closest Championship win in history. In 1984, he beat his teammate Alain Prost by just 0.5 points!

Max Verstappen ðŸ‡³ðŸ‡±

"Mad Max"
4 Titles

18 Age Debut

The defining driver of the current generation. Max skipped F2 and jumped straight into F1 at age 17. His driving style is aggressive and uncompromising.

Did You Know? Max is the reason the rules changed. Because he joined so young (17), F1 created the 'Verstappen Rule' requiring drivers to be 18.
